name: TheAtlantic
text: "In a world where Twitter is but one of many megaphones at public figures’ disposal, the supposed benefit or efficacy of removing such content is debatable," @evelyndouek writes: https://t.co/OXB1Los425

name: TheAtlantic
text: "While Andrew Cuomo was benefiting from heart-string-tugging segments on CNN, his state was struggling … Journalism that truly aims to restore trust in media would hold Cuomo to account for these missteps," argues @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/uUS5aHdvKt

name: TheAtlantic
text: What happens if the United States pulls out of the WHO during the pandemic? Listen to The Atlantic's "Social Distance" podcast: https://t.co/6ecOGqsCej

name: TheAtlantic
text: The widely watched videos of people proudly refusing to wear face masks are outrageous. They are also misleading, @megangarber writes: https://t.co/GknNcJKCIp

name: TheAtlantic
text: Even before the pandemic forced people into lockdown, many undocumented immigrants in the United States were used to confining themselves, @emdashkap reports: https://t.co/KBKA9I06li

name: TheAtlantic
text: The sand may be safe, but what if Americans are too timid to return to shore towns and spend money? @russellberman looks at our upcoming Pandemic Summer: https://t.co/YIOlS6i5LX

name: TheAtlantic
text: In our new series "Behind the Byline," @amandamull shares what's on her mind, her favorite stories from her "Material World" column, and how she approaches her work. https://t.co/5Ig7zZxjqE

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If I act like Netanyahu, Israel might as well keep Netanyahu. Our struggle against him is part of a wider struggle for our way of life, for the nature of Israeli democracy," @yairlapid writes: https://t.co/ItnSE950lr

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Though much of the world has come to a standstill as a result of the pandemic, China’s regional ambitions and grudge settling clearly have not." -- @TMclaughlin3:
https://t.co/BDEj1bmEDV

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Here’s what @HillaryClinton once told me about Mark Zuckerberg: “I feel like you’re negotiating with a foreign power sometimes... He’s immensely powerful... This is a global company that has huge influence in ways that we’re only beginning to understand.” https://t.co/et4fbFDwE8

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @wiczipedia: Imagine if this were the US:

"If an election were scheduled to take place while the country was under lockdown, citizens would simply...vote securely from the comfort and safety of their homes, as they have done since 2005."

My latest, for @TheAtlantic https://t.co/dwGKjz1Edo

name: TheAtlantic
text: Countries across Europe are setting out schedules for reopening businesses, yet schools remain closed. Watch out for the coming setback for women in the workplace, writes @RachelDonadio: https://t.co/wP0tdz42gw

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @danteramos: As Americans start reopening their lives, they face daily dilemmas: Should I invite a friend over? Is it okay to date? But as @JuliaLMarcus writes, American health officials offer few answers for the questions people are really asking. https://t.co/f7y7xAiT8h

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "The deepest joy of grandmotherhood for me has been how it elongates time... In the days before March 7, whenever I was with the girls, they had my full attention for as long as they wanted it; they deserved nothing less. Now less is all I give them." https://t.co/VgOhdisOvB

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even as states begin to ease social-distancing rules," @JuliaLMarcus writes, "Americans are receiving very little help in resolving any of the countless practical dilemmas they are encountering every day." https://t.co/Vi8ndTu6e1

name: TheAtlantic
text: Will anyone trust the 2020 election results? @IsaacDovere investigates: https://t.co/w0fCeWxj5f

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @amandamull: If you're struggling to figure out whether the things you want to do this summer are safe, I wrote a primer on how to think through risk in any situation based on what's currently known about how the coronavirus spreads. https://t.co/qEEvKigRZe

name: TheAtlantic
text: Some Democrats believe that Biden should adopt Bernie Sanders’s "Not me, us" rallying cry for himself—with a twist, @RonBrownstein writes. https://t.co/0I6NeRf42f

name: TheAtlantic
text: In January, Hillary Clinton told @AdrienneLaF that she believes Mark Zuckerberg’s unwillingness to battle the spread of disinformation on Facebook is “Trumpian” and “authoritarian.” Read the interview here: https://t.co/Fk5RxENhXr

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Perhaps the dereliction of the duty to protect and defend basic decency should not surprise anyone at this point," @conor64 writes. https://t.co/v5U6qz491n

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"What is boring and, notwithstanding the boredom it induces, also very nasty?" @benjaminwittes found it's a hard standard to meet:
https://t.co/BZGXm89ASt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In the days before March 7, whenever I was with the girls, they had my full attention for as long as they wanted it; they deserved nothing less. Now less is all I give them," @robinhenig writes: https://t.co/ptEwMeWHfV

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch live: @AdrienneLaF joins @gillianbwhite to discuss our June cover story on QAnon—and how conspiracy theories have shaped America: https://t.co/qJRgT53jDK

name: TheAtlantic
text: Across the country, mutual-aid groups are using workplace chat apps and database tools—software designed to make money for companies—to give things away and donate time, @kait_tiffany reports: https://t.co/8ZE0uRiIMT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sometimes, social-media mobs are not only justified but necessary. The case of Amy Cooper shows why, @zeynep writes: https://t.co/98KKxsH2Uz
